content: prior written consent from the designer contact lisa at fibernymph@gmail com decreases continued round 3 k2tog yo k2 to end of round round 4 repeat round 2 round 5 k2tog yo k2tog to end of round 54 stitches round 6 k1 p1 to last two stitches k1 slip last stitch directly onto right needle without twisting remove marker slip_stitch back onto left needle again without twisting replace marker round 7 k2tog yo k1 to end of round round 8 k1 p1 to last two stitches slip last two stitches directly onto right needle without twisting remove marker slip both stitches back onto left needle again without twisting replace marker round 9 k3tog yo to end of round 36 stitches round 10 k1 p2 k2 p1 to last six stitches k1 p2 k2 slip last stitch directly onto right needle without twisting remove marker slip_stitch back onto left needle again without twisting replace marker round 11 k2tog yo to end of round round 12 k1 p1 to last two stitches k1 slip last stitch directly onto right needle without twisting remove marker slip_stitch back onto left needle again without twisting replace marker round 13 k2tog to end of round 18 stitches round 14 k1 p1 to last two stitches k1 slip last stitch directly onto right needle without twisting remove marker slip_stitch back onto left needle again without twisting replace marker round 15 k2tog to end of round 9 stitches break yarn learning 18 tail with tapestry needle thread tail yarn through remaining nine stitches and cinch up snugly insert needle through center of the snugged stitches to the inside of the hat weave in tail well to keep top from opening weave in cast on end lisa beamer is an unrepentant fiberholic who knits and spins into the wee hours of the morning on a regular basis she is the owner of fibernymph dye works which can be found at http //fibernymph etsy com she is also the host of the weekly knitting videocast 90% knitting which can be downloaded through itunes or can be found at the fdw blog http
